page.title: 11European Expressway
page.content: The A55 expressway starts in Llanddulas .It took 3 and a half years to build.A Â£34.7 million contract was shared between Fairclough and Mc.Alpine. It was built by the sea so sea defence was needed.They used 22,000 interlocking concrete blocks called Dolos units.They look like a Twisted H. In the future the road will be called E22- a European route.The railway had to be rerouted and a new bridge constructed.The road was opened on 7th December 1984 by Mr. Wyn Roberts MP. for Conway.Most people think the expressway is an improvement .Reasons are:no traffic jams,quicker to get to places and keeping traffic from Llanddulas.A small minority think it is bad because of mess and noise.People are worried Colwyn Bay will lose trade due to the expressway.
